entry.title: Git Tips
entry.content:
• Find commit list which contains [function]
git show `git log --oneline [path-to-file] | cut -c 1-8` | egrep -rs "[function]|commit"
  • Search
git log --oneline --author=[email]
git branch --contains [commit id]
git log -S"keyword" [path-to-file]
  • Change Author
git commit --amend --author=[email]
  • Rebase
git rebase -i HEAD~[number_of_commits]
edit
git commit --amend
git rebase --continue
  • Reset
git reset --hard [commit-id]
git reset --soft @{1}
git reset --hard HEAD
git reset --hard HEAD^
  • Remote
git branch -r
git remote show origin
  • Diff
git log --oneline [tag1]..[tag2]
git log --oneline [branch1]..[branch2]

entry.title: Github Pages and Octopress
entry.content:
One way to create and write your own blog.

Create new repository in github

For example, eyan0221.github.io.git

Install rvm

curl -L https://get.rvm.io | bash -s stable
rvm install 1.9.3
rvm use 1.9.3
ruby --version

Setup Octopress

git clone git://github.com/imathis/octopress.git octopress
cd octopress/
gem install bundler
bundle install
rake install

Deploy Github Pages

sudo apt-get install nodejs
rake setup_github_pages
rake new_post
rake preview        # check output in http://localhost:4000
rake generate
rake deploy
git push git@github.com:eyan0221/eyan0221.github.io.git source

Reference

  1. zerodie Github
  2. Octopress Setup
  3. Markdown Syntax
  4. Markdown Wiki
  5. TOC in Octopress
  6. brizzled github
  7. Another Octopress TOC
